result.execSummary:
The defendant Jadis B Fields was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: PTAC], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Joint & several with co-def. DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$243 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with AR or MKJ Jr (co-def)
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jadis B Fields

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List (Plaintiff's)
Final pre-trial on August 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Michael J. or Adam R.
  Trial Judge - Br 5

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Paul L. Barnett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.
